description:
Creolimax fragrantissima is a species of small freshwater snail belonging to the family Hydrobiidae. It is found in certain regions of Europe, primarily in Germany and neighboring countries.

This snail species is characterized by its small size, typically reaching a shell height of around 2-3 millimeters. The shell is conical in shape, with a smooth surface and a pointed apex. The color of the shell can vary from light brown to greenish-brown.

Creolimax fragrantissima inhabits slow-moving or stagnant freshwater bodies, such as ponds, lakes, and slow-flowing streams. It is often found living among aquatic vegetation or on submerged rocks and debris.

The species is known for its ability to produce a distinctive, fragrant odor, which is the origin of its specific epithet "fragrantissima." This odor is believed to be a defense mechanism against potential predators.

Creolimax fragrantissima is an important component of freshwater ecosystems, playing a role in the food web and contributing to the overall biodiversity of the habitats it occupies.
